description.narrative: Wildlife crime is combated on the ground through strengthening enforcement operations in targeted protected area complexes & relevant community-management arrangements are officially established in the Niassa National Reserve

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
PROJECT OBJECTIVE Indicator 1. IRR Output 2.5 indicator 2.5.1: Extent to which national legal, policy, and institutional frameworks are in place for conservation, sustainable use, and access and benefit sharing of natural resources, biodiversity and ecosystems.
Indicator 2. Number of direct project beneficiaries: - (UNDAF indicator 9.4.2): Nº. of communities benefiting from NRM related revenues - Number of local people in project areas benefiting from engagement in conservation activities and/or improved livelihoods attributable to the project (male/female)
Indicator 3. Number of individuals of IWT flagship species (e.g. lion, cheetah, leopard, rhino, elephant) at the project sites (site level)
OUTCOME 1 Indicator 1. Presence of operational coordination mechanism to implement W&FC Strategy
Indicator 2. Capacity of ANAC on IWT control as indicated by customized UNDP Capacity Development Scorecard
OUTCOME 2 Indicator 1. Results of law enforcement on poaching and IWT in the project areas (site level): a. # of law enforcement staff/km²[1] b. # of patrol person-days/month c. # of arrests/patrol month f. # of wildlife/wildlife product seizures at program sites[4] /year g. # of investigations that lead to arrests of wildlife/wildlife / products smugglers/ a year h. # of prosecutions of wildlife/wildlife product smugglers / year
OUTCOME 4 Indicator 1. Number of project lessons on IWT control and CBNRM used in development and implementation of other conservation projects, with at least one lesson on gender mainstreaming
Indicator 2. (a)Number of national and international organizations that participate in the project M&E and provide feedback to the Management Team; (b) % of women among all participants of the project activities, including M&E

-Number of direct project beneficiaries: - (UNDAF indicator 9.4.2): Nº. of communities benefiting from NRM related revenues 52 -Number of local people in project areas benefiting from engagement in conservation activities and/or improved livelihoods attributable to the project (male/female) 50,263 (female) 57,442 (male) Number of individuals of IWT flagship species (e.g. lion, cheetah, leopard, rhino, elephant) at the project sites (site level) Results of law enforcement on poaching and IWT in the project areas (site level): a. # of law enforcement staff/km²[1] 0.006 b. # of patrol personday/month-2000 c. # of arrests/patrol month :2 f. # of wildlife/wildlife product seizures at program sites[4] /year: 60 g. # of investigations that lead to arrests of wildlife/wildlife / products smugglers/ a year h. # of prosecutions of wildlife/wildlife product smugglers / year: 10 - Level of management effectiveness at site level as measured by METT score:50 - Total number/area of new conservancies officially established in the project areas (ha) : inception /20% of corridor under conservation / SLM/sust. NRM agreement - Annual number of HWC in conservancy area :30% decrease - # of integrated landscape management plans implemented:2 - Area (ha) under SLM/SFM :450

-Design of the W&FC and IWT strategy started in 2020 not concluded as of limitations caused by COVID19 -On ground anti-crime operations involving ANAC, PPRNMA (Environmental Police), Environmental Quality Agency(AQUA), and Investigation Police(SERNIC- -Four security plans were carried out in 3 national parks and 1 national reserve - This year 2020 will complete one more year in which no elephants have been recorded as lost to ivory poaching in Niassa Special Reserve. - Niassa Special Reserve has developed a local Law Enforcement (LE) strategic plan under the aegis of the CITES MIKES program. The has been to maintain the improvement in patrol intensity in the Reserve with NSR foot patrols now achieving on average 1,268.8 kms (NSR only) and 3,719.4 km (combined with operators) on foot per month. - Create and deploy fire response team -The total number of local people benefiting for the project is currently 5286 --Several operations were held on the ground by ANAC, PPRNMA (Environmental Police), AQUA(Environmental Quality Agency) for detention and seizure of illegal wildlife products in local markets among other suspicious sites; -ANAC has stablished a permanent inter-institutional collaboration with relevant institutions for IWT such as Investigation Police (SERNIC), Secret Services, Environmental Police, Justice Sector ( a deputy prosecutor specifically assigned to this area) and Immigration Services -A total of 16 training sessions on conservation legislation and importance of conserving forests were implemented with members from the 16 NRMCs, community leaders, district government representatives and community members

-Number of direct project beneficiaries: - (UNDAF indicator 9.4.2): Nº. of communities benefiting from NRM related revenues 52 -Number of local people in project areas benefiting from engagement in conservation activities and/or improved livelihoods attributable to the project (male/female) 50,263 (female) 57,442 (male) Number of individuals of IWT flagship species (e.g. lion, cheetah, leopard, rhino, elephant) at the project sites (site level) Results of law enforcement on poaching and IWT in the project areas (site level): a. # of law enforcement staff/km²[1] 0.006 b. # of patrol personday/month-2000 c. # of arrests/patrol month :2 f. # of wildlife/wildlife product seizures at program sites[4] /year: 60 g. # of investigations that lead to arrests of wildlife/wildlife / products smugglers/ a year h. # of prosecutions of wildlife/wildlife product smugglers / year: 10 - Level of management effectiveness at site level as measured by METT score:50 - Total number/area of new conservancies officially established in the project areas (ha) : inception /20% of corridor under conservation / SLM/sust. NRM agreement - Annual number of HWC in conservancy area :30% decrease - # of integrated landscape management plans implemented:2 - Area (ha) under SLM/SFM :450

At project start an estimated 10,037 people live in the Marrupa-Mecula corridor. Activities have started to ensure Community Hunting quota share, (presently 20% share from revenue achieved), apiculture activities started, trainings on financial literacy, purpose of associations, and fire management provided. Currently 1 committe awaiting publication in Boletim da Republica, 3 recognized and registered in state finance system (enabled to receive benefits from revenues). a) 0.0053 b) 1800 c) 0.4 d) e) f) 30 g) 66 (cases in court) h) 26 (cases ruled in court) NB: g) and h) are exceptionally high, because efforts were made to move several pending cases forward to reach court and prosecution. Human Wildlife Conflict mitigation: Different fences are being tested in the Reserve (mobile electric and thorny plants) and preparations for the implementation of a permanent fence model are ongoing having passed through mapping of affected areas (crops) and involved wildlife species and preparations for a series of public consultations are ongoing. Awareness raising campaigns were conducted in villages with elevated HWC incidents to advise villagers about how to prevent incidents from occurring (block farming, sleeping inside safe shelters, fishing methods, garbage handling). The registry and communications of HWC incidents is currently be changed to gain more efficiency and respond swifter. An apiculture pilot project was started in one village involving the fabrication of the beehives by the community, the construction of a honey “house” where honey will be processed and stored, the creation of an administrative community-based honey entity, and the installation and maintenance of 320 beehives in a fire-safe location in the village’s vicinity. Based on the existing and envisaged land occupation and natural resources use and by employing a participatory framework a zoning model was developed which was presented at various levels from community, district to provincial and got accepted. We have also developed a land management model based on tourism concessions and concessions that will be administered by the communities. The areas of two community management units were identified. The boundaries of these areas will physically be marked - a process which includes local authorities, district planning, villagers and Reserve’ administration. Anti-poaching patrolling in PA: Aerial and terrestrial anti-poaching patrolling is being conducted and has become integral part of the law enforcement strategy

-National W&FC and IWT Strategy adopted by GoM and started with the implementation -WCU is established with at least 3 technical staff - -Nº. of communities benefiting from NRM related revenues 52 -Presence of operational coordination mechanism to implement W&FC Strategy -Annual number of HWC in conservancy area
